The diamondback terrapin (Malaclemys terrapin) or simply terrapin, is a species 
of turtle native to the brackish coastal swamps of the eastern and southern United 
States, and in Bermuda. It belongs to the monotypic genus, Malaclemys. It has 
one of the largest ranges of all turtles in North America, stretching as ... The name 
"terrapin" is derived from the Algonquian word torope.
